display.title: display widget simple value
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display the value of the session variable x

display.title: display widget current database record
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display the current record on an instance page

display.title: display widget UI state
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display current URL, theme (light/dark), screen width, and location info

display.title: display widget showing object
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display the current time as a key-value list

display.title: display widget showing link
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display a link to a record in the database

display.title: display widget showing table
display.description: Used to visualize the result of any jsonata expression. Here, we display a list of objects as a table

display.title: display widget showing an image
display.description: if the object has exactly the key 'img' (with optional width and height), the result is displayed as an HTML image with the value of the img field being used as the image src attribute

display.title: display widget showing a hyperlink
display.description: if the object has exactly the key 'href' or the keys 'href' and 'label', the object is displayed as a hyperlink

display.title: display widget showing a hyperlink
display.description: absolute or relative links to another page in the app are specified without the 'slash hash' part of the URL - for instance, the href 'Info' or '/page/Info' links to the Info page

display.title: display widget on dashboard page
display.description: shows how a display widget is added on a dashboard page

display.title: display widget on instance page
display.description: shows how a display widget is added on a database instance page

display.title: display widget on table page
display.description: shows how a display widget is added on a table page

display.title: display widget with JSON keys containing special characters
display.description: SQL queries create JSON with field names 'table.column'. In JSONata, enclose the field name in backticks (`)

card.title: card widget
card.description: The card widget shows its children within a card

container.title: container widget for authenticated role
container.description: Provides a logical container for its children. This example displays children only if the user in the the role 'authenticated'

container.title: container widget conditionally showing contents
container.description: Provides a logical container for its children. This example displays children only if the jsonata expression is true

container.title: container widget showing contents for each value
container.description: Provides a logical container for its children. This example shows the child for each value of the foreach expression

expansion.title: expansion widget shows children in an expansion panel
expansion.description: Provides a logical container for its children and shows them in an expansion panel

stepper.title: stepper widget displays its children as a wizard
stepper.description: allows stepping through its children. It displays the step number and title along with the child at the current step position

tabs.title: tabs widget displays its children as tabs
tabs.description: displays its children in a tab container which allows selecting the current tab on top

button.title: button widget
button.description: shows a button to trigger an action with an optional set of inputs. This example prints the contents of the form input

button.title: button widget: Dynamically compute form fields
button.description: schemaExpression is an expression that computes JSON Schema which in turn defines the form fields dynamically

button.title: button widget: show a form field conditionally
button.description: schemaExpression is an expression that computes JSON Schema which in turn defines the form fields dynamically: The 'type' field is defined as the switch. Other fields can specify 'case' with the type value of when they are shown

button.title: button widget: computing select options
button.description: The button form has a select field to input 'id'. The select options are computed from the database

button.title: button widget: JavaScript expressions
button.description: Expressions that start with // JavaScript can use JavaScript. This example triggers a file download

button.title: button widget: JavaScript expressions
button.description: Expressions that start with // JavaScript can use JavaScript. This example calls the $read() function and returns the result

create.title: create widget
create.description: Shows a form on the database table page to create a new database record

edit.title: edit widget
edit.description: Shows a form on the instance page to edit or delete the instance

variable.title: variable widget
variable.description: Shows a form that sets session variables. This example sets the variable 'field'

actionTable.title: action table
actionTable.description: Visualizes 'expression' as a table. The 'properties' field contains an object where the keys are button labels and the values contain actions to be performed when the button is pressed. The action expression gets the context passed which includes the selected objects in the 'selected' field

aichat.title: aichat widget
aichat.description: chat widget that allows you to react to user inputs and file uploads. this example answers (without AI) by simply repeating what the user asks. the chat is initialized with a simple message

aichat.title: aichat widget
aichat.description: chat widget that allows you to react to user inputs and file uploads. this example calls a AIApp function called aia

analytics.title: analytics widget
analytics.description: displays the results of a SQL query as a chart or table. Allows placing filters on the widget that the user can set when viewing the widget. The database, table, columns, and filter fields determine the SQL query: in this case, it is 'select user, count(ID) from REQUESTS where submitted >= ?' on the database 'sqlite'. Possible filter input widgets are: text, slider, switch, date, select, and selectmultiple.

chart.title: chart widget
chart.description: displays a chart based on a query or expression. the first column is used as labels for the X-axis. The second column holds the Y-Values. This example shows the results of the 'group' query from the query catalog run on the northwind database. The chart is a bar chart.

chart.title: chart widget
chart.description: displays a chart based on a query or expression. the first column is used as labels for the X-axis. The second column holds the Y-Values. This example uses a JSONata expression to compute a table using two columns in order to display it as a line chart.

datagrid.title: datagrid widget
datagrid.description: Displays the result of a JSONata expression as an editable table. We have callbacks ondelete (context 'id' contains the primary key of the row to be deleted), onchange (updatedRow contains the new value of the row), and oncreate (no context is given - in this example, the code computes a new unique primary key by running select max(id) from table)

diagram.title: diagram widget
diagram.description: displays a boxes and lines diagram where each box represents a database record. The expression 'nodes' computes the boxes. The fields database, table, and id denote the database record (in the example an EMPLOYEE). Optionally, you can specify the box label (data.label) and the box position (position.x and position.y)

editRelated.title: edit related widget
editRelated.description: Allows editing related records of a database record. In this example, the order instance page allows editing all the order details directly. The link between the tables is established via the 'prop' field, which contains the column ID of the foreign key

graph.title: graph widget
graph.description: display a directed labelled graph showing the result of an OpenCypher query

graph.title: graph widget
graph.description: display a directed labelled graph showing the nodes specified by a JSONata expression. Initially, this graph has no edges

html.title: html widget
html.description: Allows you to specify HTML. The context expression can be used to inject dynamic content into the HTML via the template ${context}. You can also provide JavaScript functions that can be called from your HTML code (e.g. function 'go')

icon.title: icon widget
icon.description: shows a material icon with an optional link (href) and tooltip text

links.title: links widget
links.description: on an instance page, shows links to all other related records and the corresponding table page

map.title: map widget showing a list of addresses
map.description: The address can be as simple as 'jp' for Japan, or it can be a specific street address. The widget chooses the appropriate center and zoom level automatically

map.title: map widget showing a specific address with a popup linking to a record
map.description: Using the points field, you can specify a popup which display the data like the display widget. In this case, we show a link to a database record

markdown.title: markdown widget
markdown.description: shows markdown that can be fed dynamic content via the 'context' JSONata expression

mdxeditor.title: mdxeditor widget
mdxeditor.description: a WYSIWYG editor that can be extended with custom menus. 'properties' defines the actions, 'expression' defines the menu structure

table.title: table widget
table.description: shows the result of a query. this example uses mode auto which chooses a mobile friendly table layout when viewed on small devices

table.title: table widget
table.description: shows the result of a JSONata expression as a table

text.title: text widget
text.description: shows a hyperlink with an icon in front

tree.title: tree widget
tree.description: shows a tree using a recursive query 'orgchart'. The query must have a parameter 'node' and is evaluated every time a node is opened in the tree view

tree.title: tree widget
tree.description: shows a static tree that is suitable for a side navigation. The tree nodes can provide an icon, text, href, and nested child nodes

uploadfile.title: uploadfile widget
uploadfile.description: Allows uploading files to the upload directory. Note that WebDAV must be turned on using the WEBDEV_ENABLED environment variable
